alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 5:21PM MDT until September 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following counties, Los Alamos and Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 519 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moved over the Cerro Pelado burn scar between 4pm and 5pm. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen over parts of the burn scar. Additional heavy rainfall is possible later this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cochiti Pueblo and Pena Blanca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
